ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Too agressive with forms?
ygData.msgSnippet: This is by design; these values (and options) are often fetchable URIs that browsers visit, either because of Javascript code that triggers on form actions or

Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Too agressive with forms?

This is by design; these values (and options) are often fetchable URIs that
browsers visit, either because of Javascript code that triggers on form
actions or a server-side redirect. So, when such values look like they could
be URIs -- have a '.' or '/' in them -- Heritrix tries them. Usually, trying
a few bad URIs has little cost to either the crawler or the target site,
and we would rather err on the side of inclusion.

In some cases, this has caused inconveniences -- large numbers of error
fetches in crawler or remote server logs, or auto-notification messages to
webmasters. We've corrected these on a site-by-site basis so far.

However, there's an outstanding RFE to make the aggressiveness of the HTML
(and possibly other) extractors more configurable. See:

   [ 913002 ] Extractor aggressiveness needs to be configurable
   http://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?func=detail&aid=913002&group_id=73833&atid=539102

It shouldn't be too hard but it hasn't yet been assigned anyone or
targetted for a release -- we'd welcome a code contribution if anyone
would like to tackle this, or has interesting ideas on what levels of
aggressiveness should be selectable.

- Gordon @ IA

ryanatl wrote:
> Using: heritrix-1.5.1-200509291859
> 
> Heritrix tried to crawl this URL:
> http://www.anns-personalized-books.com/jiff/my_zoo_rhymes/my-zoo-rhymes-page.htm
> 
> And then proceeded to try to 
> GET /jiff/my_zoo_rhymes/service@...
> 
> If you view the source to my-zoo-rhymes-page.htm, you'll see a hidden value field with the 
> email address in question as a value, but no where else on the page.
> 
> I've also seen this behavior with HTML select statements, where Heritrix will try to GET URLs 
> for every option value parameter.
>
